snippet: Karl Heiselman, the head of Wolff Olins, a brand consulting firm, says job candidates’ sincerity about their goals can be more important than whether they are an exact fit for the position.
abstract: Adam Bryant Corner Office column features Q&A with Karl Heiselman, chief executive of international brand consulting firm Wolff Olins.
lead_paragraph: Karl Heiselman, the head of Wolff Olins, a brand consulting firm, says job candidates’ sincerity about their goals can be more important than whether they are an exact fit for the position.

headline.print_headline: What’s Your Story? The Answer, He Says, May Land You a Job
headline.seo: Wolff Olins’ Chief Asks Applicants ‘What’s Your Story?’
headline.main: What’s Your Story? The Answer May Land You a Job
